Tucson looks to the dragon, not knowing him, and looking to his strange bla=
ck coloration along with his silver as well.  He was stiff with apprehensio=
n, yet, knew not to rouse this dragon.

"How did you know who I am?  And wh=
o are you?  I find that rather strange that you know me, seeing that the ol=
d dragon had no mention of another, yet alone another who can converse in m=
y language."

He gets up, and stands rather stiffly.  He's swift to shift h=
is weight around, and put himself in front of the mouth of the cave.

" I'm=
 sorry, but my child is about to be born and I wish no harm to come to it."=
